flow.descriptionCdata:
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.0da99957-3ef2-4843-9067-d209fb14e115.description=
Subtracts two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The difference of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.5092a0ac-4735-4921-9ba7-aecec19e7932.callout=Compute the difference between before and after sizes and so get the size of the cleanup files/folders. c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.55ac5b6b-b0e1-4dd3-b638-69d2e1e4164f.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.65fbae34-3fdb-45ad-8952-78873f00e6f2.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.6ec7843a-3b69-4543-87e2-060733078393.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.970d560f-961b-42fa-9bb6-1b26f56adf1c.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.d73077eb-4bcf-4aad-bc04-b4fc7b4ad47d.callout=Linux Disk Cleanup. Select the desired filter for the cleanup and/or give the paths to be cleaned. c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.dae1a9f3-ccff-4c7d-a8b6-bd9ba678ae52.callout=Compute local filesystems size before cleanup operation. c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.description=
Cleanup the temporary folders from Linux. This flow uses the SSH protocol to execute a cleanup script on the target machine.

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine, where the script file will run.
Default value\: 127.0.0.1
    username - Username of the target machine.
    password - Password for the user.
    cleanupSystemFiles - If this input is "Yes", then this flow will delete also the system temporary files on the target machine.
Default value\: No
Valid values\: Yes, No
    cleanupPaths - A list of filters values to use for deleting the specified files/folders on the target machine.
Examples\: /var/tmp/*, /home/root/abc*.txt, "/path with space/"*, "/path with space/myfile.txt"
    delimiter - The list separator.
Default value\: ,

Responses\:
    success - The cleanup script was successfully launched and has completed executing on the target machine.
    failure - There were problems in the execution of the cleanup script.

Results\:
    returnResult - This result contains the total number of bytes deleted from the local filesystems from the target machine.
    StdOut - Standard output from the remote process.

Notes\:
1. The cleanup size can be negative if during the cleanup process there are created files bigger than the deleted files.
2. The cleanup size is measured in the units used in Windows. Ex\: bytes, KB \= 1024 bytes, MB \= 1024 KB, GB \= 1024 MB etc.
3. The cleanup size is computed only for the local file systems.

Optional inputs\:
    port - The port number for running the command.
Default value\: 22
    workingDirectory - A temporary folder where the script will be executed.
Default value\: /
Examples\: /tmp, /home, /var/tmp
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000
    characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine.
Default value\: UTF-8
Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.eceb5275-cfa9-42bf-8876-d21f2f26e4af.description=
Execute a shell script on a Linux machine using the SSH protocol. The shell script is written to a temporary file on the target machine in the folder given by the input workingDirectory. There the temporary file is executed and in the end deleted.

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine, where the script file will run.
Default value\: 127.0.0.1
    username - Username of the target machine.
    password - Password for the username. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
    script - A shell command or a shell script.

Responses\:
    success - The script was successfully launched and has completed executing on the target machine.
    failure - There were problems in the execution of the script.

Results\:
    returnResult - The result of the remote command.
    StdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    StdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\:

Optional inputs\:
    port - The port number for running the command.
Default value\: 22
    privateKeyFile - Path to private key file.
    workingDirectory - A temporary folder where the script will be executed.
Default value\: /tmp
Examples\: /tmp, /home, /var/tmp
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000
    characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine.
Default value\: UTF-8
Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8
c549f766-beff-4f19-8f3e-46eacc0ca3b8.ed2e9462-e330-48ac-b1f3-a2d392568cc3.callout=Compute local filesystems size after cleanup opeartion.
flow.name: File System Cleanup on Linux

scriptlet.name: Step Set filters in Flow File System Cleanup on Linux (65fbae34-3fdb-45ad-8952-78873f00e6f2)
Step Subtraction in Flow File System Cleanup on Linux (0da99957-3ef2-4843-9067-d209fb14e115)

staticBinding.value: Total cleanup size on local filesystems is ${difference_with_unit}.
